item.title: Report E-2024100269
item.description:
Report E-2024100269

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T09:22:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: GRAPEVINE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UAC Intl
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Another IAC arranged the delivery of the freight by shipper to our facility on Sep 18th, 2024. As an IAC-CCSF, we were advised to screen & transfer the freight to the air carrier of the shipment for airlines booking made via the other IAC. There was a pick up truck which arrived to our facility to deliver the crate and when the driver was asked to provide proper identification and sign our check-in sheet, he left w/o either. We, UAC INT'L, notified the IAC about this incident. Due to the suspicious delivery activity, we opened the crate which we did not accept on behalf of the IAC and discovered 3 loose Lithium Ion Batteries in the crate. We notified the IAC and DFW TSA of the incident accordingly.

item.title: Report E-2024100222
item.description:
Report E-2024100222

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T09:22:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-11
  • City: TYLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1134 ET, XPO terminal LTY notified ERTS of a cargo refused shipment that took place 08/2024. It was reported that approximately 1 ounce of Amazing Product Liquid Fire Drain Line Opener released from (1) 1-ounce plastic container due to reasons unknown. The release impacted cardboard box the product is overpacked in. The release has since dried, as it happened over a month ago but was just today sent back to them from the customer. The terminal will reach out to the shipper to see if shipper would like the product returned to them. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The terminal used oil dri as an absorbent and a 30-gallon poly drum for the waste. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024100192
item.description:
Report E-2024100192

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-09T09:22:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-10
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 07:01 EST, ERTS was contacted XPO Logistics about a cargo release. It was reported due to a forklift incident, approximately .5 gallon of Chlorine Bleach 2000 (hazardous - UN1791) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the dock floor. The terminal advised they already cleaned and contained the release. The released product, damaged drum, and oil-dri were placed into a 65-gallon poly drum and staged in for terminal personnel to handle. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report X-2024100359
item.description:
Report X-2024100359

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-02
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/2/2024 at approximately 1245, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 393838 at the ramp facility in Fort Worth, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box that contained 4 glass bottles of petroleum crude oil. The package was damaged by mechanical equipment, resulting in one of the glass bottles breaking and spilling. There is no secondary containment or positive closure. The cushioning between the bottles was insufficient. The broken glass and damaged outer package were placed in a salvage drum for proper disposal and the remaining bottles were placed in a separate drum, awaiting an amended Shipper's Declaration for futher transport.

item.title: Report E-2024100147
item.description:
Report E-2024100147

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-09
  • City: EL PASO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0856 ET, XPO terminal LEP notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported approximately 1-gallon of Acetone Isobutyl Isobutyrate released from a total of (3)5-gallon metal pails due to improper loading. The release impacted trailer # 3173004. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. Contractors containerized the (3) damaged pails of Acetone Isobutyl Isobutyrate product to (2) 55-gallon metal drums along with impacted rags. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024100137
item.description:
Report E-2024100137

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-05
  • City: HOUSTON

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1130 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal LHO. It was reported that approximately 5 gallons of Endurabond B Cement/Tack 500 were released from (2) 5-gallon DMs due to improper loading. The release impacted the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE and oil dri available on site. 217000-1: 55-gallon DM contains (2) damaged pails of product, impacted oil dri. The drum was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024091936
item.description:
Report X-2024091936

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-04T12:22:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-23
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During switching operations yard crew noticed JRTX 11206 seeping from the manway. After inspecting found manway swing bolts a total of (6) to be less than tool tight. Manway was opened and nozzle gasket was found to be in good condition. Manway was closed and tool tightened, and security seals were placed on manway & protective housing.

item.title: Report X-2024100147
item.description:
Report X-2024100147

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-04T12:22:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-23
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operation at the AFWH location a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained two metal cans separated by a fiberboard divider, positive closure rings and packing paper for dunnage. The lid on one can was open spilling the contents. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
